text:
Park Avenue, east side at 40th Street, showing the Nurses' Club at the S.E. corner of 40th Street and the National Navy Club next to it. On the N.E. corner may be seen the Architects' Building, 101 Park Avenue, built 1916, and the smaller and rather older Terminal Building, No. 103.
Notice the traffic signal tower characteristic of the mid 1920's. October 12, 1927.

P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

119 East 40th Street, north side, between Park and Lexington Avenues.

1914.

Park Avenue, west side, from 4'th to 41st Streets, showing the Murray Hill Hotel.
Gift of E. M. Jenks
1918

(1)
Park Avenue, east side at 40th Street, seen from a considerable height. On the N.E. corner stands the Architects' Building, 101 Park Avenue, built about 1916. On the S.E. corner may be seen the Nurses' Club, and next to it the National Navy Club. The other buildings facing Park Avenue in that block, beginning with the small 3-story house to the right of the Navy Club, will be demolished in 1931. The skyscraper in the right background is the Chanin Building. December 2, 1931.

P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

(2)
The same.

December 2, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Park Avenue, east side at 40th Street, seen from a considerable height. On the N.E. corner stands the Architects' Building, 101 Park Avenue, built about 1916. On the S.E. corner may be seen the Nurses' Club, and next to it the National Navy Club. The other buildings facing Park Avenue in that block, beginning with the small 3-story house to the right of the Navy Club, will be demolished in 1931. The skyscraper in the right background is the Chanin Building. December 2, 1931.

P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

(2)
The same.

December 2, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

Murray Hill Hotel, Park Avenue, west side, from 40th to 41st Streets, showing part of the 41st Street side of the Hotel Belmont, the latter hotel, although much newer, will be demolished in 1931. In the foreground may be seen the southern end of the Pershing Square viaduct. Behind the Murray Hill Hotel, on the right, may be seen a large office building under construction at the N.E. corner of Madison Avenue and 41st Street. Compare this with the picture taken in 1918.

June 1925.

Brown Brothers, Photographers.

Park Avenue, west side, at 40th Street, showing the old Murray Hill Hotel, from 40th to 41st Streets, and the houses on the S.W. corner of 40th Street which will be demolished in 1931.
February 6, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Park Avenue, west side, from 40th to 42nd Streets, including two buildings on the S.W. corner of 40th Street which will be demolished in October 1931. The old Murray Hill Hotel is shown in the block from 40th to 41st Streets and the Hotel Belmont (1906-1931) in the block above it, as they appeared before the Lincoln Building was erected alongside the Belmont at 60 East 42nd Street.
At 40th Street may be seen a traffic signal tower of the type in use from about 1925 to 1928.
February 6, 1928.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

(2)
The same, but a closer view not showing the S.W. corner of 40th Street, taken after the erection of the Lincoln Building and before the demolition of the Hotel Belmont (1906-31).
December 13, 1930.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

(3)
The same, showing the clearing on the S.W. corner of 40th Street, and the view of the Hotel Biltmore, on Vanderbilt Avenue from 43rd to 44th Streets, made possible by the demolition of the Hotel Belmont in the block north of the Murray Hill Hotel.
December 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

(1)
Park Avenue, west side, from 40th to 42nd Streets, including two buildings on the S.W. corner of 40th Street which will be demolished in October 1931. The old Murray Hill Hotel is shown in the block from 40th to 41st Streets and the Hotel Belmont (1906-1931) in the block above it, as they appeared before the Lincoln Building was erected alongside the Belmont at 60 East 42nd Street.
At 40th Street may be seen a traffic signal tower of the type in use from about 1925 to 1928.
February 6, 1928.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

(2)
The same, but a closer view not showing the S.W. corner of 40th Street, taken after the erection of the Lincoln Building and before the demolition of the Hotel Belmont (1906-31).
December 13, 1930.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

(3)
The same, showing the clearing on the S.W. corner of 40th Street, and the view of the Hotel Biltmore, on Vanderbilt Avenue from 43rd to 44th Streets, made possible by the demolition of the Hotel Belmont in the block north of the Murray Hill Hotel.
December 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

(1)
Park Avenue, west side, from 40th to 42nd Streets, including two buildings on the S.W. corner of 40th Street which will be demolished in October 1931. The old Murray Hill Hotel is shown in the block from 40th to 41st Streets and the Hotel Belmont (1906-1931) in the block above it, as they appeared before the Lincoln Building was erected alongside the Belmont at 60 East 42nd Street.
At 40th Street may be seen a traffic signal tower of the type in use from about 1925 to 1928.
February 6, 1928.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

(2)
The same, but a closer view not showing the S.W. corner of 40th Street, taken after the erection of the Lincoln Building and before the demolition of the Hotel Belmont (1906-31).
December 13, 1930.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

(3)
The same, showing the clearing on the S.W. corner of 40th Street, and the view of the Hotel Biltmore, on Vanderbilt Avenue from 43rd to 44th Streets, made possible by the demolition of the Hotel Belmont in the block north of the Murray Hill Hotel.
December 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

Murray Hill Hotel, 40th Street side, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Park Avenue.

August 1, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

40th Street, south side, from Park to Madison Avenues. The corner house, 78 Park Avenue, is being demolished.
October 2, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

Park Avenue, north from 40th Street, showing the Grand Central Station as rebuilt during the years around 1910, the Pershing Square Viaduct conducting motor vehicles from 40th to 46th Streets, and the demolition of the Hotel Belmont on the west side of the Avenue from 41st to 42nd Streets. The New York Central Building (1928) at 46th Street is seen over the roof of the Station. Underneath the station clock, in front of the large window and facing south on the Viaduct, may be seen the statue of Commodore Vanderbilt, who built up the New York Central Railroad system.

June 14, 1931.

P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

(1) Park Avenue, west side, from 40th to 41st Streets, showing the old Murray Hill Hotel, which dates back to the 1870's, against a background of modern skyscrapers. To the right is the Lincoln Building, completed late in 1929, at 60 East 42nd Street, and to the left the Lefcourt Colonial Building (1929) on the S.W. corner of Madison Avenue and 41st Street and the Murray Hill Offices building (1926), which together take up the entire east side of Madison Avenue from 41st to 40th Streets. Behind the latter, to the left of the Lefcourt tower, may be seen the top of 500 Fifth Avenue, completed on the N.W. corner of 42nd Street in January 1931. December 2, 1931.

P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

(2) The same, but showing a little of the clearing at the S.W. corner of 40th Street, and missing the tops of the Lincoln and Lefcourt Colonial buildings. In the block above the Murray Hill, from 41st to 42nd Streets, the Hotel Belmont has been demolished. Through the gap thus created may be seen the west side of Vanderbilt Avenue at 43rd Street; the Hotel Biltmore (erected about 1914) is the building shown in part on the N.W. corner. December 2, 1931

P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

(3) The same, showing a portion of Grand Central Station on the right with its elevated vehicular viaduct. December 2, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

Park Avenue, west side, from 41st to 40th Streets, showing the old Murray Hill Hotel and part of the excavation, at the N.W. corner of 41st Street, left by demolition of the Hotel Belmont.
In the immediate foreground southbound automobiles on the Pershing Square Viaduct are shown waiting for the green light.

October 21, 1931.

P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

Murray Hill Hotel: Spiral
From Park Avenue and 40th Street, Manhattan

Federal Art Project
"Changing New York"
Berenice Abbott, photographer

[Note: negative at Museum of the City of New York]
Code I A-1
Nov. 19, 1935

p.138, Changing New York
